results.title: Keep it green
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: One-third of the world’s agricultural production is destroyed each year by pests and diseases. Geographical isolation has helped protect Australia so far, but with increasing frequency and speed of modern communication the risk of their accidental introduction becomes greater every year. Plant Quarantine Inspectors check cargoes and passengers’ baggage, as they come into the country. Within industries such as sugar and rice, scientists work to improve commercial varieties and reduce disease.

results.title: Keep in the swim
results.creator_credit: Movietonenews and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: The need to obey rules to insure safety on the roads is illustrated by pictures of good and bad driving. The lesson is reinforced by shots of the champion swimmers Jon and Ilsa Konrads who in their training to become champions have to follow rules set out by the laws of swimming.

results.title: Keep fit, study well, work hard
results.brief_description: Contrasts schooling in China, where the stress is on discipline and group activities, with schools in the United States. Uses an admonition of Mao Tse Tung’s “keep fit, study well, and work hard”.

results.title: Keep clean, eyes open: your responsibility
results.creator_credit: J Lyons and Co and Terence Weathers
results.brief_description: A key to cleanliness film which deals with food poisoning in the home, in a shop, in a restaurant or in a factory. The film explains poisoning - concentrating on germs and makes some suggestions for prevention of contamination.

results.title: Keep 'em in the fairway
results.brief_description: Highlights the five golf fundamentals which the Professional Golfers’ Association (PGA) believes essential to every good golf swing. Features golfers Bobby Jones, Sam Snead, Ben Hogan and others.

results.title: Keen as mustard
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly and Bridget Goodwin
results.brief_description: This program emphasises the age old axiom “don’t volunteer” following the top secret chemical warfare experiments conducted on Australian volunteers during World War II. Scientists, laboratory assistants and volunteers recount their horrific experiences with the Australian Chemical Warfare Unit and the mustard gas experiments amidst the tropical beauty of Northern Queensland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly and Bridget Goodwin

results.title: Keeling over
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and Greg Stitt
results.brief_description: Auckland’s Hauraki Gulf is one of the finest sailing areas in the world, and Bruce Farr is a New Zealand yacht designer with an international reputation. When two Farr yachts engage in three days racing over a course the scene is set for some spectacular sailing.

results.title: Keats Stories about Peter
results.brief_description: Goggles - Peter finds a pair of motorcycle goggles without lenses, but when he and Archie set off with their treasure they run into some big boys and trouble. “A Letter to Amy” - Peter wants to invite a girl to his birthday party so he writes her a special letter. “Peter’s Chair” - Angered by the attention given to his baby sister, Peter is ready to run away from home with his chair and other treasures.

results.title: Kaziranga: main stronghold of the Indian rhino
results.brief_description: The Kaziranga Game Reserve in Assam India. Shows elephants working and wild but concentrates on the endangered Indian rhinoceros including the capture of a young Indian rhinoceros for transportation to a zoo. Commentary by Frank Phillips.

results.title: Kayaking: the basic skills
results.creator_credit: Vincent Drane, Gary Pedicini and Ed Brumby
results.brief_description: Kayaking: the basic skills provides instructors and teaches with demonstration models, analyses of good technique and a summary of major coaching points for teaching basic flat water skills and white water manoeuvres to novice paddlers. It includes points about equipment and safety, turning strokes, forward and reverse paddling, support strokes, ferry glides, breaks ins and outs and capsize drill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Drane, Gary Pedicini and Ed Brumby
